You don't often get email from c.c.suitters@pgr.reading.ac.uk. Learn why this is important

Hello everyone, it’s Sappo time once again!

We hope everyone has recovered from last night’s Met Ball, and we were pleased to come out on top after a heated Mr Mets auction! If anyone needed definitive proof of the popularity of certain members of the department, we don’t need any fancy elections*, just put cartoon faces on mugs and see who attracts the biggest bid…

Away from politics, we first bring reports of some fishy goings-on in Newcastle. No, one of the “under the sea”-themed props from last night did not go missing. Instead, a junior doctor was greeted by a goldfish on his lawn, with absolutely no idea how it got there. Upon finding it, he waved it into his home and begun nursing it back to life, placing it in an empty freezer drawer of water. Alice the goldfish, as it is now known, has recovered and is said to be “doing swimmingly well” – in shark contrast to some of the table balloons from last night (RIP the Octopus). But the doctor is not fin-ished there, he now plans to get Alice some fishy friends and keep them all as pets, in what we think is a r-eel-y nice gesture.

For news item number two from Sappoo this week, we bring you important news from across the poond in Arizona. A man here is displaying record-breaking collection of coprolite** in a museum, after breaking the record in 2015 and stool holding it to this day. In the display in the “Poozeum” (the jokes just write themselves don’t they?), there are a potty remarkable 8000+ exhibits for you to gaze your eyes upon. And for free entry, it sounds like a toiletally pootiful*** day out!

Finally, we share news of some wheely daredevil garden apparatus. Dylan Phillips of Wales has modified a wheelbarrow and set a Guinness World Record for the fastest speed achieved in a wheelbarrow****, of 52 mph! The wheelbarrow was modified to go faster using a scooter that Dylan barrowed from the scrapheap, but it was fast enough to leave the competition in his rake as he left them all behind.

That’s all this week, see you at the SCR later if you have recovered enough from last night!
The Sappoteers

* see flyer
** a fancy way of saying “fossilised poo”
*** this is meant to say “totally beautiful” but I think I was trying too hard to fit more puns in here
**** there really are records for anything nowadays right?
